newsitem.title: CANADA: Thunder Bay vessel clearances - May 6.
newsitem.headline: Thunder Bay vessel clearances - May 6.

text.p: Daily vessel loading/clearances at Thunder Bay, Ontario:
Date Vessel Cargo (MT) Status Destination
May 3 Kapitonas Andzajauskas 10,000 GSPs Clrd 5/3 Foreign Pt
May 3 Mapleglen 20,000 wht Clrd 5/3 Bay Ports
May 4 Algonorth 25,000 -- Clrd 5/4 Stl Ports
May 5 McGiffin 25,000 bly Ldng 5/5 USA Port
May 5 Kinsman Independent 17,000 wht Ldng 5/5 USA Port
May 5 Milan Kamak 10,500 flx/must Ldng 5/5 Foreign Pt
May 5 Lake Champlain 19,100 peas Ldng 5/5 Foregin Pt
May 5 Ziemia Tarnowksa 18,000 wht Insp 5/5 Foreign Pt
May 5 Utviken 18,000 wht Waiting Foreign Pt
May 5 Mantadoc 13,000 m/wht Waiting Port Colborne
May 5 Canadian Venture 17,000 -- Waiting 3 Rivers
May 5 Algoville 27,000 -- Waiting Stl Ports
May 5 Canadian Provider 25,000 -- Waiting Stl Ports
May 5 Algontario 26,000 -- Waiting Stl Ports
May 5 Algocape 26,000 -- Due 5/5 Stl Ports
May 5 Federal Fuji 18,000 peas Due 5/5 Foreign Pt
May 6 Canadian Trader 26,000 -- Due 5/6 Stl Ports
May 6 Cartierdoc 25,400 -- Due 5/6 Stl Ports
May 7 Windoc 25,000 -- Due 5/7 Stl Ports
May 8 El Kef 20,000 wht Due 5/8 Foreign Pt
May 8 Malinska -- -- Due 5/8 Foreign Pt
May 13 Federal Saguenay -- -- Due 5/13 Foreign Pt
May 15 Balaban 1 -- -- Due 5/15 Foreign Pt
May 17 Great Laker -- -- Due 5/17 Foreign Pt

NOTE: Thunder Bay reopened April 1 when H.M. Griffith cleared. Source: Lake Shippers Clearance Assn. Note wht=wheat, can=canola, m/wht=milling wheat, M=meal, P=pellets, O=oil. Ready=preparing to load. MT=metric tonne. Stl Ports=St Lawrence Ports. Wind=Windsor.
